faqs.question: Will my child cope with such a long day?
faqs.answer: From our experience, children want to arrive early and stay as late as they can get away with! With some of our younger students we use some educational software to break up the day and keep them engaged.

faqs.question: What are the starting and ending times?
faqs.answer: The classes run from 9:30 am to 4:00pm. We are open from 8:30am for early arrival and close at 5:00pm for late pick up (at no additional charge).

faqs.question: How well supervised are these classes?
faqs.answer: There is 1 teacher for up to 8 students.

faqs.question: Can children leave during the class?
faqs.answer: Your children will be under our supervision at all times while on site for the day. We require written permission from a parent if the child needs to leave the premises for any reason.

faqs.question: Will they be doing anything other than using a computer all day?
faqs.answer: Of course! In addition to the class content, there is ample time for children to play computer games both by themselves and with each other. There will be space available to socialise and eat together during breaks away from the computer. There is plenty of outdoor space to stretch and take in the gorgeous Victorian sunshine!

faqs.question: How do children get looked after with such a broad range of ages?
faqs.answer: Children are grouped according to age and "buddied up" alongside another child of similar age and experience.

faqs.question: Can my two children sit next to each other?
faqs.answer: In most cases they can. However, sometimes if they are on two different classes they may be in two adjacent rooms.

faqs.question: What do they do for lunch and other breaks?
faqs.answer: Children bring their own food and drinks. They can only leave the premises to get lunch if they have written permission from their parents.

faqs.question: What do they get when they finish for the week?
faqs.answer: Children can bring a USB to take home all the work they have done.
